node.author: André Breton
node.quote: Beauty will be convulsive or will not be at all.

node.author: André Breton
node.quote: All my life, my heart has yearned for a thing I cannot name.

node.author: André Breton
node.quote: It is living and ceasing to live that are imaginary solutions. Existence is elsewhere.

node.author: André Breton
node.quote: Words make love with one another.

node.author: André Breton
node.quote: Of all those arts in which the wise excel, Nature's chief masterpiece is writing well.

node.author: Salvador Dali
node.quote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.

node.author: Salvador Dali
node.quote: I don't do drugs. I am drugs.

node.author: Salvador Dali
node.quote: Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.

node.author: Salvador Dali
node.quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.

node.author: Salvador Dali
node.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.

node.author: Francis Picabia
node.quote: A free spirit takes liberties even with liberty itself.

node.author: Francis Picabia
node.quote: The world is divided into two categories: failures and unknowns.

node.author: Francis Picabia
node.quote: Only useless things are indispensable.

node.author: Francis Picabia
node.quote: Good taste is as tiring as good company.

node.author: Jean Arp
node.quote: Art is a fruit that grows in man, like a fruit on a plant, or a child in its mother's womb.

node.author: Jean Arp
node.quote: I wanted to create new appearances, to extract new forms from man.

node.author: Jean Arp
node.quote: As there is not the least trace of abstraction in this art, we will call it concrete art.

node.author: Jean Arp
node.quote: Artists should work together like the artists of the Middle Ages.

node.author: Jean Arp
node.quote: We do not wish to copy nature. We do not want to reproduce, we want to produce... directly and without meditation.

node.author: Joan Miro
node.quote: I try to apply colors like words that shape poems, like notes that shape music.

node.author: Joan Miro
node.quote: The works must be conceived with fire in the soul but executed with clinical coolness.

node.author: Joan Miro
node.quote: Throughout the time in which I am working on a canvas I can feel how I am beginning to love it, with that love which is born of slow comprehension.

node.author: Joan Miro
node.quote: The more ignoble I find life, the more strongly I react by contradiction, in humour and in an outburst of liberty and expansion.

node.author: Joan Miro
node.quote: The painting rises from the brushstrokes as a poem rises from the words. The meaning comes later.

node.author: Man Ray
node.quote: A creator needs only one enthusiast to justify him.

node.author: Man Ray
node.quote: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just the determination to realize them.

node.author: Man Ray
node.quote: Don't put my name on it. These are simply documents I make. "

node.author: Man Ray
node.quote: One of the satisfactions of a genius is his will-power and obstinacy.

node.author: Max Ernst
node.quote: All good ideas arrive by chance.

node.author: Max Ernst
node.quote: Painting is not for me either decorative amusement, or the plastic invention of felt reality; it must be every time: invention, discovery, revelation.

node.author: Max Ernst
node.quote: Woman's nudity is wiser than the philosopher's teachings.

node.author: Max Ernst
node.quote: Art has nothing to do with taste. Art is not there to be tasted.

node.author: René Magritte
node.quote: Everything we see hides another thing, we always want to see what is hidden by what we see.

node.author: René Magritte
node.quote: Art evokes the mystery without which the world would not exist..

node.author: René Magritte
node.quote: The mind loves the unknown. It loves images whose meaning is unknown, since the meaning of the mind itself is unknown.
